title: New construction permits in the last 2 years

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: New construction permits in the last 2 years
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show all new construction permits issued by the Nevada EPA for Washoe, Storey, and Lyon counties in the period from 2022 - present, including but not limited to facility ID, applicant, address, date of application, date of issue/approval, and type of facility. Please provide this in a tabular format such as a CSV or Excel file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ariel Smith

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: New construction permits in the last 2 years
communications.communication:
Good morning, Ariel,

Are you just looking for Air permits? I’m in the Bureau of Air Quality and want to verify that’s all you need. Nevada Division of Environmental Protection Air Bureau doesn’t have authority in Washoe country, they have their own air program.  You would need to contact them directly for any air permits. I will assemble a list of air permits we’ve issued for Lyon and Storey county and get that to you by the end of the week.

Regards,

Misti Gower
Management Analyst III
Administrative Branch Supervisor, Bureau of Air Quality Planning
Nevada Division of Environmental Protection
mgower@ndep.nv.gov<mailto:mgower@ndep.nv.gov>
(O) 775-687-9494

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: San Fran VA Budget Docs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Access to the budget information of the San Francisco Veterans Affairs
Healthcare System Facility for fiscal years 2021-2022, 2022-2023, and 2023-
2024, utilizing terminology outlined in the "FY 2024 VA Budget in Brief"
document available on VA's website.

Specifically, I am requesting the following information for each fiscal year
mentioned above:

1. Total Appropriations: - The total budget allocation (obligations and outlays)
for the San Francisco Veterans Affairs Healthcare System Facility.

2. Program Level Detail (broken down by category and itemized as available)
a. Personnel Costs: Including salaries, wages, and related benefits for
employees.
b. Medical Services & Medical Community Care Services: Expenditures
related to medical care services and Medical Community Care services
provided to veterans.
c. Medical Support and Compliance: Costs associated with support services
and compliance efforts within the healthcare facility.
d. Facilities: Expenditures for maintaining and operating healthcare facilities.
e. Information Technology: Costs related to information technology
infrastructure and services.
f. Construction: Expenditures for construction projects within the facility.
g. any and all other appropriate categories

3. Budgetary allocations designated for specific programs or initiatives within
the facility, corresponding to the categories listed in the "FY 2024 VA Budget
DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
San Francisco VA Health Care System
4150 Clement Street, Mail Stop 00C/PO
San Francisco, CA 94121
“America is #1-Thanks to our Veterans.”
in Brief" document.

4. Any reports or documents indicating financial performance or budget
adjustments made throughout each fiscal year.

5. Any additional relevant financial information or documents that would
provide insight into the financial operations of the San Francisco Veterans
Affairs Healthcare System Facility during the specified fiscal years, utilizing
the terminology as outlined in the "FY 2024 VA Budget in Brief" document.
(Date Range for Record Search: From 09/01/2020 To 02/06/2024)”

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jasper Craven

communications.subject: VHA FOIA Request: 24-06040-F
communications.communication: Jasper Craven, Attached to this message is VHA’s acknowledgment of your FOIA Request. Your request has been assigned to me for processing.  I would kindly appreciate your confirmation of receipt of this email.  A hard copy of the attached letter will not follow in postal mail unless specifically requested by you. If you should have any questions, please feel free to contact me at 415-221-4810 x22135. Sincerely, Nancy Ungson , FOIA Officer

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: San Fran VA Budget Docs

communications.subject: VACO FOIA - 18-07090-F Still Interested
communications.communication:
We are writing to confirmwhether you are still interested in the FOIA request below. Due to staffingchanges, we were unable to confirm whether we previously responded to thisrequest. In accordance with the Department of Justice (DOJ), Office ofInformation Policy (OIP), July 2015 guidance on still-interested inquiries, https://www.justice.gov/oip/limitations-use-still-interested-inquiries,we are providing you with 30 working days to confirm whether you are stillinterested in this FOIA request. If we do not hear from you within 30 workingdays we will administratively close this request. You can file a new requestfor the same information at any time. (https://www.justice.gov/oip/limitations-use-still-interested-inquiries) 

Thank you for your patience as we work on improving our FOIA program and clearour backlogged FOIA requests. 

If you should have any questions, please feel free to contact me at202-461-6448. Sincerely, Latonya Hooks , Program Specialist 
Sincerely, 
Latonya Hooks , Program Specialist 

FOIA REQUEST 18-07090-F 
All e-mail communications between White House advise Jake Leinenkugel and VA officials including, but not limited to, Casin Spero, Darin Selnick, Curt Cashour, David Shulkin, Scott Blackburn, Thomas Bowman, Peter O'Rourke, Brooks Tucker and Jonathan Ullyot between Jan. 20, 2017 and present day. Keywords should include, but are not limited to, "VA," "accountability," "choice," "congress," "CVA," "private."

communications.subject: FOIA 24-06040-F
communications.communication:
Hello Mr. Carven,



Attached are the initial agency decision letter (IAD) and responsive records to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated February 10, 2024.



Your FOIA tracking number is 24-06040-F.


If you have any questions about your request, you may contact the San Francisco VA Health Care System FOIA Office at 662foia@va.gov<mailto:662foia@va.gov>.


Thank you,

San Francisco VA Health Care System FOIA Office

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jeramy Gilliam death investigation (FBI)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- all documents mentioning Jeramy Gilliam, a Richmond, Virginia resident killed by a Richmond Police Department officer in 2002.

This story in WTVR confirms Gilliam's death and additionally mentions an FBI Richmond field office investigation into the incident: https://www.wtvr.com/news/local-news/interim-richmond-police-chief-wont-answer-questions-about-2002-shooting

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

{ Whittney Evans }

    { Whittney Evans }
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fjeramy-gilliam-death-investigation-fbi-96612%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2MnNxOre1oSHteLnfMK20oc%3A1joJ56%3AfYlLHNvv_2nL4E_ZZj_fmMhMtIg

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1469387-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 104 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 853 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,786 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,500 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)

I have located this data at the following link: https://data.ca.gov/dataset/election-data/resource/67e83a65-2b55-41ec-9420-b33b666d4711

However, the data at this link does not contain the full text of the initiative/referendum. In addition, it contains only information on elections dating back to 1986, while I request data for elections dating back to 1972.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda

communications.subject: 24-0231 - California Public Records Act Request of March 5, 2024
communications.communication:
Dear Jimin,

Thank you for contacting the California Secretary of State with your request for records pursuant to the California Public Records Act. A copy of your request is attached.

The Secretary of State has a portion of the requested information on local ballot initiatives and referenda from the years 1995 to 2022.  That information  can be accessed on the Secretary of State’s website through the following links: https://www.sos.ca.gov/elections/ballot-measures/resources-and-historical-information/reports-county-and-municipal-initiative-measures; https://www.sos.ca.gov/elections/county-city-school-district-ballot-measure-election-results.

For historical statewide initiative resources, you may find useful information on the Secretary of State’s website through the following link: https://www.sos.ca.gov/elections/ballot-measures/resources-and-historical-information/history-california-initiatives

In addition, you may wish to contact local county elections offices for any other information pertaining to local ballot initiatives and referenda.
We hope this information is helpful to you. If you have any questions about this or another matter related to records available at the Secretary of State’s Office, please contact us again.

Sincerely,


Public Records Act Request Staff
Legal Affairs Office
California Secretary of State
E: PRAPublicRequest@sos.ca.gov<mailto:PRAPublicRequest@sos.ca.gov>

[California Secretary of State Logo]
[cid:image002.png@01DA7C2F.E7283510]<https://www.sos.ca.gov/>[Facebook Link]<https://www.facebook.com/CaliforniaSOS/>      [Instagram Link] <https://www.instagram.com/californiasos_/?hl=en>       [Twitter Link] <https://twitter.com/CASOSvote>      [Youtube Link] <https://www.youtube.com/user/CaliforniaSOS>

Confidentiality Notice: This email message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure, or distribution is prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply email and destroy all copies of the original message.

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Louisiana DOC Inmate Disciplinary Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Internal administrative and operational procedures documents relating to inmate disciplinary procedures, including but not limited to prohibited acts, sanctions, and standard operating procedures, as well as any related attachments.

2. A copy of your most recent general inmate handbook along with any related attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Grace Paley (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All files on or related to Grace Paley, a prominent writer, academic, and activist, whose death in 2007 was widely reported by the media: https://www.nytimes.com/2007/08/23/books/23cnd-paley.html

I am a career journalist with work that has appeared in various publications such as MuckRock, The Simmons Voice, and The Westwood Horizon. I am willing to pay any reasonable expenses associated with this request, however, as the purpose of the requested disclosure is in full conformity with the statutory requirements for a waiver of fees, I formally request such a waiver.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mackenzie Farkus

    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    All files on or related to Grace Paley, a prominent writer, academic, and
    activist, whose death in 2007 was widely reported by the media:
    https://www.nytimes.com/2007/08/23/books/23cnd-paley.html
    
    I am a career journalist with work that has appeared in various publications
    such as MuckRock, The Simmons Voice, and The Westwood Horizon. I am willing
    to pay any reasonable expenses associated with this request, however, as the
    purpose of the requested disclosure is in full conformity with the statutory
    requirements for a waiver of fees, I formally request such a waiver.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Mackenzie Farkus
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://www.muckrock.com/accounts/agency_login/federal-bureau-of-investigation-10/grace-paley-federal-bureau-of-investigation-68567/?uuid-login=eed29a76-b15d-4ca2-b069-1034ce2360ff&email=efoia%40subscriptions.fbi.gov#agency-reply

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Grace Paley (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 138 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 571 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,289 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,649 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 122 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 1,230 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,010 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,370 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: shapefile for election precincts in March 2024 election

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: shapefile for election precincts in March 2024 election
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

a GIS shapefile of the electoral precincts as they defined for the March, 2024 election

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

Good afternoon, Mr Gregg,
For your (and others') convenience, the Board has already uploaded our current precincts' shapefile to the "Chicago Data Portal" (https://data.cityofchicago.org/ ). Since they carry a number of  such files, one fairly easy way to find the file - using their search bar - is to 
1. search for "precincts", then 
2. scroll through the resulting list to "Boundaries - Ward Precincts (2023- )"
You'll probably find two entries, a "Map" view which will show you precincts, and another "DataSet" version with a slightly more direct button to the download - although you can reach the same dataset via the map view as well.  
This precinct map, with 1291 precincts, covers not only this election but the two Municipal Elections (Feb General and April Runoff) in 2023.  In fact, it's nearly the same for the Nov 2022 General (which had 1290 precincts - the first election which we administered using the "2022 Wards", derived and approved from the 2020 Census ReDistricting).  Between Nov 2022 and Feb 2023, one precinct - Ward 24 pct 16 - was split in two, subsequently becoming precincts 16 and 20.  Merge Wd 24, pcts 16 & 20 in this file, and it should describe the Nov 2022 results as well .  Previous elections (including the 2022 spring Primary ) used the Wards (and precincts) from the prior Census' redistricting.

We also have a number of Ward & Precinct maps, Legislative District maps, Lists of precincts within Legislative Districts, along with election results, etc, via our website "chicagoelections.gov",   Currently the March 19 primary results are still being counted, due to obligatory waiting periods for mail ballots, provisional ballots, etc. 

I hope this answers your question.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Secure Scheduling Council Email Metadata
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Metadata for all emails sent or received by Council Members or Staff during the period 1/1/2016–12/31/2018 that contain any of the following (non-case-sensitive) phrases: "secure scheduling", "secured scheduling", "secure schedule", "secured schedule", "secure schedules", or "secured schedules." The requested metadata includes, but is not limited to, the following email attributes or fields: From, To, Cc, Bcc, Subject, SentDate, ReceivedDate, Size, Attachments, Importance, ReadStatus, ConversationID, Categories, FlagStatus, Sensitivity. I would prefer to receive these records as an electronic spreadsheet (.xlsx or .csv file) with separate rows for each email and separate columns for each attribute.

I am requesting these records for non-commercial research purposes. The records will be made available to the general public. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C169558-020124
communications.communication:
Dear Peter Fugiel, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C169558-020124 received on February 01, 2024 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV24-C169558-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C169558-020124. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-C169558-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Colorado Secretary Of State - Elections Division)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Colorado Secretary Of State - Elections Division)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)

This website from California provides a good example of the type of data I am requesting:
https://data.ca.gov/dataset/election-data/resource/67e83a65-2b55-41ec-9420-b33b666d4711

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

communications.subject: Thank you for contacting our office
communications.communication:
If you need to update your voter registration, you can do so online by visiting www.GoVoteColorado.gov<http://www.GoVoteColorado.gov>.

If you need to mail a voter registration form, we recommend sending it directly to your county clerk and recorder. County contact information is available on our website at https://www.coloradosos.gov/pubs/elections/Resources/CountyElectionOffices.html.

We’ll respond to your inquiry as quickly as possible.

Thank you.

Dear Matthew Fecteau,

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 

I want the complete module this lesson was pulled from. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Matthew Fecteau 

Attachments: 

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/mjf/132173/9A_Lesson_6_Legal_Aspects_17July23_3.pdf 
Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fnew-york-state-department-of-state-2391%252Flesson-module-158263%252F%253Femail%253Ddos.dl.FOIL.WebContact%252540dos.ny.gov&url_auth_token=AAAcSQqdb-MWdaUiszkKwj0DWn4%3A1rWspx%3Ae1j1LdmbREE4xEmLCFy0Gpi5tWcKVRD2_6vJrThIllc" 
Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law. 
A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request. 
Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs. When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made. 
Sincerely, 
NYS Department of State

Benton County ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-142 has been submitted successfully. Thank you. Your request has been received and assigned the above tracking number. Please use this tracking number on all correspondence. We will follow-up within 5 business days and advise you of the status of your request. Benton County is excited to announce the launch of our public records portal. The portal makes it easy for you to submit requests, get updates, and access documents. This portal allows us to provide excellent constituent services while strengthening open and transparent government. Our partners at NextRequest help us deliver on these promises by combining the best of modern cloud technology with user centered design. communications.subject: [External Message Added] Benton County public records request #24-142
communications.communication:
Benton County ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #24-142: Dear Ms. Terse:   We received your request on February 11, 2024, and it was assigned tracking number 24-142. Please use this tracking number on all correspondence regarding this request. This letter serves to acknowledge your request pursuant to RCW 42.56.520. You have requested:   “All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.”   We are reviewing your request and have determined that additional time is needed for the search of potentially responsive documents and legal review of exemptions under the law. Based on these reasons, we estimate your request will be fulfilled in its entirety on or about March 21, 2024. Should this estimate need to be revised, we will notify you as soon as possible.    We will notify you when the non-exempt documents are ready for release along with the associated copying and mailing fees. Thank you in advance for your patience concerning this matter. Should you have any questions or concerns regarding your public records request, please contact our office at 509-735-3591.   Best Regards, Heather Jones Certified Public Records Officer Benton County Prosecutor’s Office 7122 West Okanogan Pl. Suite A230 Kennewick, WA 99336 T: (509) 735-3591 ext. 3333 Heather.Jones@co.benton.wa.us ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Benton County.
Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: [Document Released to Requester] Benton County public records request #24-142
communications.communication:
Benton County ************************************************************************ A document has been released for record request #24-142 along with the following message: Re:     Request Tracking No. 24-142 Dear Ms. Terse: The non-exempt records which are responsive to your public records request are ready for release. We have not included an Exemption Log as there were no records withheld or redacted. You can access and download the records through your NextRequest account. Per Benton County Code 5.14.120, there is no charge for this request. In the event any of the documents provided to you, or a portion thereof, appears to be privileged or exempt, the disclosure is inadvertent, and the County does not waive any applicable exemption or privilege. If you become aware that any of the documents provided to you appear to be exempt from disclosure, please notify me immediately and promptly return the erroneously released document. We now regard your request as fulfilled and closed. Should you have any questions or concerns regarding the determination of exemptions, please contact our office at (509) 735-3591. Best Regards,   Heather Jones Certified Public Records Officer Benton County Prosecutor’s Office 7122 West Okanogan Pl. Suite A230 Kennewick, WA 99336 T: (509) 735-3591 ext. 3333 Heather.Jones@co.benton.wa.us * 1-Potential Impeachment Disclosure (Brady) List-Updated.pdf Document links are valid for one month. title: Leak referrals and consultations (Securities and Exchange Commission)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Leak referrals and consultations (Securities and Exchange Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of documents, including but not limited to emails, memos, letters, reports, briefs and call logs, referring to, discussing or generated as a result of referrals to and consultations with the Federal Bureau of Investigation and other components of the Department of Justice (Criminal Division, Civil Division, National Security Division, the Attorney General's office, etc.), regarding instances of unauthorized disclosures of information (AKA leaks) for investigation and/or prosecution between January 20, 1981 (or the date of creation of this agency, whichever came first) and the present. 

I request "news media" status and a fee waiver, see attached.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

To whom it may Concern - PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56


AS RECENTLY REPORTED IN THE NEWS:

Michael Benjamin Griffin - Principal - Sunrise Elementary School - 14075 172nd Avenue NE Redmond, WA 98052 - 425-408-5300

Meghan Suzane Griffin - Principal - Moorlands Elementary School - 15115 84th Avenue NE Kenmore, WA 98028 - 425-408-5100

Administrators meet face-to-face after principals caught with COCAINE and GUNS

https://www.fox13seattle.com/news/administrators-meet-face-to-face-after-principals-alleged-drug-use-lands-them-on-leave

Sunrise Elementary School Principal Michael B. Griffin and Moorlands Elementary School Principal Megan S. Griffin – Cocaine and guns

https://komonews.com/news/local/2-northshore-school-district-principals-administrative-leave-alleged-cocaine-use-firearms-qfc-grocery-store-moorlands-elementary-sunrise-police-law-enforcement-campus-drugs-narcotics-officers-criminal-charges

Police find cocaine, loaded gun; two elementary principals placed on administrative leave

https://www.wftv.com/news/trending/cocaine-loaded-gun-lead-two-elementary-principals-being-placed-administrative-leave/6XT7SFY6TBB5HNZIOCKDHIG6MU/


PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56:

I request any/all public records of the following:

1.	COCAINE – Use of cocaine by Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers on or off elementary school grounds.
2.	FIREARMS/HANDGUNS – Names of all Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers in possession of HANDGUNS or FIREARMS on elementary school grounds.
3.	KIDNAPPING – any records or police reports referencing KIDNAPPING and current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
4.	RESISTING ARREST - any records or police reports referencing RESISTING ARREST by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
5.	CARJACKING - any records or police reports referencing CARJACKING and current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
6.	DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL - any records or police reports referencing DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
7.	HIT AND RUN - any records or police reports referencing HIT AND RUN by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
8.	OBSTRUCTION - any records or police reports referencing OBSTRUCTION by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
9.	CRIMINAL or CIVIL CHARGES - copies of all CRIMINAL or CIVIL CHARGES of any current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
10.	GUILTY PLEAS – copies of all STATEMENT OF DEFENDANT ON PLEA OF GUILTY entered into by any former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
11.	COMPLAINTS - any records referencing COMPLAINTS by the POLICE or the GENERAL PUBLIC about current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.

NORTHSHORE SCHOOL DISTRICT ELEMENTARY MAP

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: D000157-020424
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

02/09/2024 
Re:  Public Records Request No. D000157-020424 
Dear Sunrise Parent: 
The purpose of this letter is to acknowledge receipt of your request for public records received on 2/4/2024 and to request clarification on the records you are requesting. 

You requested the following: 

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56: 

I request any/all public records of the following: 

1. COCAINE – Use of cocaine by Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers on or off elementary school grounds. 
2. FIREARMS/HANDGUNS – Names of all Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers in possession of HANDGUNS or FIREARMS on elementary school grounds. 
3. KIDNAPPING – any records or police reports referencing KIDNAPPING and current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers. 
4. RESISTING ARREST - any records or police reports referencing RESISTING ARREST by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers. 
5. CARJACKING - any records or police reports referencing CARJACKING and current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers. 
6. DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL - any records or police reports referencing DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers. 
7. HIT AND RUN - any records or police reports referencing HIT AND RUN by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers. 
8. OBSTRUCTION - any records or police reports referencing OBSTRUCTION by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers. 
9. CRIMINAL or CIVIL CHARGES - copies of all CRIMINAL or CIVIL CHARGES of any current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers. 
10. GUILTY PLEAS – copies of all STATEMENT OF DEFENDANT ON PLEA OF GUILTY entered into by any former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers. 
11. COMPLAINTS - any records referencing COMPLAINTS by the POLICE or the GENERAL PUBLIC about current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers. 

Please clarify the following: 

1. COCAINE – Please provide a name(s) of a Northshore School District (NSD) Elementary School teacher or former teacher you believe has been in possession of cocaine. 
2. FIREARMS/HANDGUNS – Concealed weapon dissemination is statutorily prohibited and would violate the subject’s right to privacy. This information would be exempt from disclosure. See RCW 42.56.240(4) and RCW 9.41.129. 
3. KIDNAPPING – Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in a Kidnapping report. 
4. RESISTING ARREST – Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in a resisting arrest report. 
5. CARJACKING – Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in a carjacking report. 
6. DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL - Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in a DUI report. 
7. HIT AND RUN - Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in a Hit and Run report. Also please note, in a hit and run incident we will often only have the victim’s information. 
8. OBSTRUCTION - Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in an Obstruction report. 
9. CRIMINAL or CIVIL CHARGES - Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in criminal or civil charges. 
10. GUILTY PLEAS – Guilty pleas are entered by the Court. You will need to contact the various local courts for guilty pleas. 
11. COMPLAINTS - Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was referenced in a complaint. I believe NSD would hold the records in regards to complaints on current or former NSD principals or teachers. Typically we only see complaints in regards to situations and/or specific officers  Please clarify what complaints you would like to receive. 

I can search the principal names provided in your request, but other than those names I have no way of knowing any other names of NSD current or former principals or teachers. In addition, it should be noted the two Principals involved recently in the news were NSD principals, but were not principals within the City of Bothell Police Department’s jurisdiction. The following elementary schools are within the City of Bothell’s jurisdiction: Canyon Creek Elementary, Crystal Springs Elementary, Frank Love Elementary, Maywood Hills Elementary, Shelton View Elementary, Westhill Elementary, Woodin Elementary and Woodmoor Elementary. See attached map of City of Bothell’s jurisdiction. 

Lastly, please provide a searchable date range. 

If we do not hear from you with clarification by 2/26/2024, we will interpret your request as only searching the elementary schools within our jurisdiction for the names provided in your request. 

It is anticipated records responsive to the foregoing interpretation will be ready by 3/4/2024. 

Please feel free to contact me at 425-487-5126 or respond to this email with any questions. 
Sincerely, 
Jessica Ertel 
Public Records Specialist, Police

4. RESISTING ARREST – Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in a resisting arrest report. 
5. CARJACKING – Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in a carjacking report. 
6. DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL - Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in a DUI report. 
7. HIT AND RUN - Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in a Hit and Run report. Also please note, in a hit and run incident we will often only have the victim’s information. 
8. OBSTRUCTION - Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in an Obstruction report. 
9. CRIMINAL or CIVIL CHARGES - Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was involved in criminal or civil charges. 
10. GUILTY PLEAS – Guilty pleas are entered by the Court. You will need to contact the various local courts for guilty pleas. 
11. COMPLAINTS - Please provide a name(s) of a current or former NSD Elementary School Principal or teacher who you believe was referenced in a complaint. I believe NSD would hold the records in regards to complaints on current or former NSD principals or teachers. Typically we only see complaints in regards to situations and/or specific officers  Please clarify what complaints you would like to receive. 

I can search the principal names provided in your request, but other than those names I have no way of knowing any other names of NSD current or former principals or teachers. In addition, it should be noted the two Principals involved recently in the news were NSD principals, but were not principals within the City of Bothell Police Department’s jurisdiction. The following elementary schools are within the City of Bothell’s jurisdiction: Canyon Creek Elementary, Crystal Springs Elementary, Frank Love Elementary, Maywood Hills Elementary, Shelton View Elementary, Westhill Elementary, Woodin Elementary and Woodmoor Elementary. See attached map of City of Bothell’s jurisdiction. 

Lastly, please provide a searchable date range. 
If we do not hear from you with clarification by 2/26/2024, we will interpret your request as only searching the elementary schools within our jurisdiction for the names provided in your request within the last two years. 

It is anticipated records responsive to the foregoing interpretation will be ready by 3/4/2024. 
Please feel free to contact me at 425-487-5126 or respond to this email with any questions. 
Sincerely, 
Jessica Ertel 
Public Records Specialist, Police

title: FOIL Request for Information on COVID-19 Tests and Masks Distribution to Schools (Sole Supervisory District Of Albany-schoharie-schenectady-saratoga Counties And Boces (capital Region))

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Information on COVID-19 Tests and Masks Distribution to Schools (Sole Supervisory District Of Albany-schoharie-schenectady-saratoga Counties And Boces (capital Region))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. All communications between the Governor's Office and/or the State Education Department and/or Boards of Cooperative Educational Services (BOCES) regarding the distribution of COVID-19 rapid test kits and N-95 and KN-95 masks to schools, dated from January 1, 2023, to the present.
  
2. Records of all requests submitted by school districts and BOCES for COVID-19 rapid test kits and N-95 and KN-95 masks, dated from January 1, 2023, to the present.

3. Inventory records detailing the quantities of COVID-19 rapid test kits and N-95 and KN-95 masks that have been delivered to each BOCES for distribution to school districts, dated from January 1, 2023, to the present.

4. Any and all guidelines, memos, or advisories issued by the Governor's Office or the New York State Department of Health (DOH) regarding the distribution of COVID-19 rapid test kits and masks to schools, dated from January 1, 2023, to the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

February 23, 2024

MuckRock News
DEPT MR 152041
263 Huntington Avenue
Boston, MA  02115

Attention Mr. Jackson Parker

Dear Mr. Parker,

Your FOIL request was received by Capital Region BOCES on February 16, 2024.    Please allow time to gather information responsive to your request by March 22, 2024.

Please note: Paula Tibbits is no longer employed by BOCES as of September 2023 and our website was immediately updated to identify me as Records Access Officer.   Please direct future FOIL requests to the following email address:  foil@neric.org

Thank you.

Mary Beth Bruno, Board Clerk
And Records Access Officer
[cid:image001.png@01DA640F.AC68D750]
Capital Region BOCES
900 Watervliet-Shaker Road
Albany, New York   12205
Phone:  518-862-4920

"Everyone you meet is fighting a battle
you know nothing about.  Be Kind. Always."
-Robin Williams

CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This email message and any attachments are for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain proprietary, confidential, or privileged information. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure or distribution is prohibited and may be a violation of law. If you are not the intended recipient or a person responsible for delivering this message to an intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply email and destroy all copies of the original message.

title: Deputy Chief AHCA/DMS (Agency for Healthcare Administration)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Deputy Chief AHCA/DMS (Agency for Healthcare Administration)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All written communications from or to Katie Strickland from the following individuals:
Jason Weida, 
Stefan Grow
Pedro Allende, or
John Schrader
 between 1/1/2021 and the present, which are in reference to the hiring of Sketch Piers in his current capacity at the Agency for Health Care Administration.

All documents relevant to the hiring of Sketch Piers in his current capacity, including the qualifications of any other candidates considered, as well as any record of Piers' previous job performance, and previous salary rates, during his tenure with the State of Florida.

All allegations of misconduct, determinations of misconduct, investigations, communications or inquiries, either resolved or pending (to the extent they are public record pursuant to FL. Stat. Ch. 119) which reference Katie Strickland and have been directed to the above listed individuals in either an official capacity or to the respective agencies under their purview.

The travel requests, approvals, calendars, and all documents pertaining to official state travel including food and lodging expenses of both Katie Strickland and Sketch Piers from the dates 1/1/2021 to the present, including prospective travel that has not occurred but has generated responsive documents as of the date of this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Lauren Grummond

title: Select Aldermanic Fair Workweek Emails (Mayor's Office)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Select Aldermanic Fair Workweek Emails (Mayor's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All emails and attachments sent or received during the period 1/1/2018–12/31/2019 by Aldermen John Arena, Patrick O'Connor, Carlos Ramirez-Rosa, Susan Sadlowski-Garza, or Tom Tunney that contain the (non-case-sensitive) phrases "fair workweek", "fair work week", or "fair scheduling." I have attached a list of 29 email addresses pertinent to this request, including aliases and Ward addresses. Please search for responsive records associated with any of these 29 addresses.

I am requesting these records for non-commercial research purposes. The records will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer that the request be filled electronically, if possible, by e-mail attachment.

Note that, in order to obtain all responsive records regardless of which public body holds them, I am submitting this request concurrently to the Chicago City Council; City Clerk; Mayor's Office; and Department of Assets, Information, and Services.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

communications.subject: [Records Center] Office of the Mayor :: F059395-102323
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 Peter Fugiel MuckRock News, DEPT MR153499 263 Huntington Ave Boston, MA 02115 RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of October 23, 2023, Reference # F059395-102323. Dear Peter Fugiel, On behalf of the Office of the Mayor, I am responding to your Freedom of Information Act ("FOIA") request which was dated October 23, 2023 and received in our office on the same day. At this time, the Office of the Mayor is seeking an extension of five additional working days to respond to the requests for one or more of the following reasons identified in 5 ILCS 140/3(e) of FOIA: (xx  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; (  ) the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; (  ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; (  ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; (  ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of the FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; (  ) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3(d) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; (  ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request. Sincerely, Olivia R. Henry Acting Mayor's Office FOIA Officer olivia.henry@cityofchicago.org 312-742-0116

communications.subject: [Records Center] Office of the Mayor :: F059395-102323
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 
Dear Mr. Fugiel, 
I am writing to address your FOIA request F059395-102323. 
As an initial matter, can you please upload your list of email addresses as a word file, or copy-paste them into the body of an email? I have downloaded the pdf and converted it to readable text but it did not transcribe properly; in its current form I am not able to search for the records specified using those email addresses. 
Additionally, I wanted to notify you that this office can only produce records from the Mayor's Office. Illinois FOIA contemplates that each distinct organization within a city’s government is its own “public body”: "Public body" means all legislative, executive, administrative, or advisory bodies of the State, state universities and colleges, counties, townships, cities, villages, incorporated towns, school districts and all other municipal corporations, boards, bureaus, committees, or commissions of this State, any subsidiary bodies of any of the foregoing including but not limited to committees and subcommittees thereof, and a School Finance Authority created under Article 1E of the School Code. Accordingly, courts have held that the City of Chicago complied with FOIA by having each department maintain a central office file containing that department’s records, expressly rejecting the contention that FOIA obligates the City to maintain a “single central office file.” Duncan Pub., Inc. v. City of Chicago , 304 Ill. App. 3d 778, 784 (1999). “Clearly, each of the individual departments are subsidiary bodies of the City and are ‘public bodies’ as defined by the FOIA. Id., see Board of Regents of the Regency University System v. Reynard, 292 Ill.App.3d 968, 978 (1997).  As such, the executive and administrative departments and offices that comprise the government of the City of Chicago each have their own FOIA officers responsible for producing the records within their department or office’s maintenance or control. To this end, a FOIA request made to the Mayor’s Office only obligates the production of responsive Mayor’s Office records. Thank you, Olivia R. Henry Acting FOIA Officer Mayor's Office 312-742-0116

I am requesting these records for non-commercial research purposes. The records will be made available to the general public. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer that the request be filled electronically, if possible, by e-mail attachment. 

Note that, in order to obtain all responsive records regardless of which public body holds them, I am submitting this request concurrently to the Chicago City Council; City Clerk; Mayor's Office; and Department of Assets, Information, and Services. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Peter Fugiel 
Postdoctoral Research Fellow 
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations 

Attachments: 

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/peter.fugiel/127815/Aldermanic_addresses_to_search.xlsx 
Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fmayors-office-885%252Fselect-aldermanic-fair-workweek-emails-mayors-office-153499%252F%253Femail%253DMOfoia%252540cityofchicago.org&url_auth_token=AAAVavwDwG8GPyXRjVmZ6s1rPx8%3A1quocZ%3AbUNXKFNYoMtWTUQnGKdOQi7IKDfV6YJEmTFHfv0jlBs" 
Responsive records are attached here and can be viewed and downloaded on the GovQA portal. 
Please be advised the Department redacted portions of the responsive records in compliance with FOIA. Specifically, emails in the deliberative process where a specific decision was being reached, as well as draft policies and memoranda, were redacted/withheld. Section 7(1)(f) exempts from disclosure, “[p]reliminary drafts, notes, recommendations, memoranda and other records in which opinions are expressed, or policies or actions are formulated, except that a specific record or relevant portion of a record shall not be exempt when the record is publicly cited and identified by the head of the public body.” 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(f). Because these records reflected opinions, recommendations, and drafts in the deliberative process, they were properly redacted under 7(1)(f). 
Additional redactions were made for personally identifying and otherwise private data, including cell phone numbers, private email addresses, and private street addresses.  These redactions are proper under Section 7(1)(b), which exempts from disclosure “private information.” 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(b). Private information is defined in Section 2(c-5) as: 
unique identifiers, including a person’s social security number, driver’s license number, employee identification number, biometric identifiers, personal financial information, passwords or other access codes, medical records, home or personal telephone numbers, and personal email addresses. Private information also includes home address and personal license plates, except as otherwise provided by law or when compiled without possibility of attribution to any person. 
5 ILCS 140/2(c-5). Therefore, these identifiers were properly redacted pursuant to Section 7(1)(b) of FOIA.Section 7(1)(c) of FOIA. Section 7(1)(c) exempts from disclosure: 
[p]ersonal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy[…] ‘Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy’ means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 
5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c). The Department properly redacted the previously mentioned identifiers pursuant to Section 7(1)(c). 
You have the right to have a denial reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General, 500 S. 2nd Street, Springfield, Illinois 62701, (877) 299-3642. You may also seek judicial review of a denial under 5 ILCS 140/11 of FOIA. 
If you have any questions or need additional information, please feel free to contact my office. 
Sincerely, 
Olivia R. Henry 
Acting FOIA Officer 
Mayor's Office

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request #F059395-102323
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Henry,

Thank you for your providing these records. I appreciate the apparent thoroughness of the search and multiple file formats of the records. I was surprised to find several emails addressed to the Mayor that were not previously released in response to my request (#F048062-060623) for emails received by the Mayor. This raises the question of whether your predecessor, Thomas Skelton, searched for Fair Workweek testimony sent to the Letterforthemayor@cityofchicago.org address. I'll plan to submit another request just for the "Letter for the Mayor" communications, unless you are able to append those to the prior release.

Sincerely,
Peter Fugiel

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Donald Barr
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to, mentioning, or generated as a result of investigation into Donald Barr (August 8, 1921 – February 5, 2004). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2004/02/10/nyregion/donald-barr-82-headmaster-and-science-honors-educator.html. Records are likely to exist on Barr as he was nominated in 1983 to be part of the National Council on Educational Research, a now-defunct body of the Department of Education.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fdonald-barr-143053%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2IK4I9uIAF_1jezhuonG71E%3A1pe4Pb%3A2jj6OHxu0E48GlBglD9-IwdV5gT5LYw5OX3dh0UP6i8

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to

include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1587001-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.
