communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
    previously
    written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over
    100,000
    readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the
    People,
    Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such, as I have a reasonable
    expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well
    established. In
    addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available
    through
    non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist
    non-profit MuckRock,
    disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to
    this, a great
    deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the
    government itself.
    As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this
    particular
    subject in advance.
    Further, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the
    released information
    to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch,
    Inc. v. Dep’t of
    Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of
    Justice, 19 F.
    3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified
    because it also
    had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning
    United States
    foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I
    qualify as a member of
    the news media.
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the
    requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made
    by” a
    representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper
    reporter, for
    example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much
    interest there is
    in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the
    details of the
    request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee
    category.
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on it and
    making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

Documentation Files

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Records mentioning or describing the neo-nazi website titled White Honor,
    hosted at WhiteHonor.com, including but not limited to references located in
    cross references such as 266N-NK-116993 or records relating either of the
    cyber incidents described in the attachments.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/72489/Anonymous20Disables20More20Than20a20Dozen20White20Supremacist20Websites20in20Coordinat.pdf
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/72489/Anonymous20Attacks20American20Nazis20-20Technology202620science20-20Security20_20NBC.pdf
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/72489/Fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?url_auth_token=AAAj2ProGzquHYFeb-SMkiAXsEc%3A1hkLQu%3ACJOIGqElGmdpKk7xfxl7H1sKxEY&next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fwhitehonorcom-76661%252F%253Femail%253Dfoipaquestions%252540ic.fbi.gov

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: FOIL Request: 2018-19 OSAS Aggregated Immunization Data at School District Level

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request: 2018-19 OSAS Aggregated Immunization Data at School District Level
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

New York State Department of Health
Bureau of Immunization

Greetings and salutations! Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (Public Officers Law, Article 6, Sections 84-90), it is my esteemed honor to request access to and copies of any and all documents providing aggregated reports at a school district level concerning the information requested in the Online School Assessment Survey (OSAS) for the 2018-19 academic year, as referenced in the correspondence sent by Dr. Elizabeth Rausch-Phung in September 2018.

The materials I kindly request should include, but not be limited to:

1. Aggregated immunization data for all students in grades pre-kindergarten through 12 at the school district level.
2. Compliance rates for each school district.
3. Any available documentation or correspondence related to schools that failed to complete and submit the survey by the December 15, 2018 deadline.

In the event that any portion of this request is denied, I respectfully request an explanation for the denial, including the specific exemption(s) under the Freedom of Information Law that you believe warrant refusal. If certain records are exempt from disclosure, kindly provide access to any reasonably segregable portion of the record.

Should you determine that some portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, I would be most grateful if you could provide me with the remainder of the records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #23-05-237
communications.communication:
Subject: Appeal for FOIL Request Delay - FOIL Request Number: 23-05-237

Dear Mr. Engel,

I am writing to formally appeal the delay and handling of my Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request submitted on May 14, 2023, regarding the 2018-19 OSAS Aggregated Immunization Data at the School District Level (FOIL Request Number: 23-05-237).

Despite multiple extension notices, the latest promising completion by December 29, 2023., the requested documents have not been provided. This delay significantly undermines the principles of transparency and accountability.

I request a review of the handling of this FOIL request and ask for timely access to the requested records. If further delays are anticipated, please provide a detailed explanation and a realistic new deadline.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

Please see attached.
Thank you, David Spellman

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Autopsy of Rufugio R Gonzalez
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Autopsy report pertaining to cause of death as well as toxicology report for Rufugio R Gonzalez . 
Date of birth was September 13, 1987 . Date of death was August 6,2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Erica Bennett
